name: Charles Leo Daniel
official_cause_of_death: Hypertensive and atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease (ruled natural causes by Pierce County Medical Examiner)

timeline.event: Taken into ICE custody after serving approximately 16-year sentence for second-degree murder
Placed in solitary confinement due to mental health issues
Found unresponsive by staff at 10:43 AM
Pronounced dead approximately one hour after being found
Pierce County Medical Examiner releases cause of death

discrepancies.counter_evidence: Daniel was held in solitary confinement for nearly 4 years - one of the longest stays in isolation at any U.S. immigration facility. UN considers solitary confinement over 15 days to constitute torture.
Daniel had documented mental health issues including hearing voices, visual hallucinations, and delusions. He often refused medications. His prolonged isolation may have exacerbated his conditions.

sources.title: Police find man dead at Northwest ICE Processing Center in Tacoma
Medical examiner says death of ICE detainee at Tacoma facility was due to natural causes
Trinidad and Tobago National in ICE Custody Dies at NWIPC

notes: Death sparked hunger strikes by more than 160 detainees at the facility. ICE Detainee Death Report available at https://www.ice.gov/doclib/foia/reports/ddrDanielCharlesLeo.pdf
